b9.title: The Pore-Forming Protein Gasdermin D Regulates Interleukin-1 Secretion from Living Macrophages
b9.reason: This study demonstrates that GSDMD facilitates active secretion of IL-1 family cytokines from live cells independently of its role as the effector of pyroptosis

b63.title: The Nlrp3 Inflammasome Suppresses Colorectal Cancer Metastatic Growth in the Liver by Promoting Natural Killer Cell Tumoricidal Activity
b63.reason: This study elegantly demonstrates that IL-18 production as a result of NLRP3 activation in the immune cells contributes to maturation of hepatic NK cells, surface expression of the death ligand FASL and capacity to kill FASL-sensitive tumours

b101.title: Cell-Type-Specific Responses to Interleukin-1 Control Microbial Invasion and Tumor-Elicited Inflammation in Colorectal Cancer
b101.reason: Using conditional gene deletion approaches in a model of CRC, this study demonstrates opposing roles of IL-1R signalling on different cell types

b126.title: Nlrp6- and ASC-Dependent Inflammasomes Do Not Shape the Commensal Gut Microbiota Composition
b126.reason: This study concludes that NLRP6 and ASC-dependent inflammasomes do not contribute in shaping the commensal gut microbiota and highlights the necessity of littermate-controlled experiments to study gene functions in the gut

b132.title: Abstract 3173: The NLRC4 inflammasome promotes breast cancer progression in diet-induced obese mice
b132.reason: This study demonstrates that IL-1β production as a result of NLRC4 inflammasome activation in immune cells of the TME of obese mice acts on adipocytes to promote VEGF production and angiogenesis

b159.title: Activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome in dendritic cells induces IL-1β–dependent adaptive immunity against tumors
b159.reason: Using tumour transplantation models, this study demonstrates that chemotherapy-mediated DAMPs released from dying tumour cells activate the NLRP3 inflammasome in DCs to regulate the adaptive immune cell repertoire

b169.title: Targeting the NLRP3 inflammasome in inflammatory diseases
b169.reason: This review highlights the evolving landscape of NLRP3 modulators and discusses opportunities for pharmacologically targeting NLRP3 with novel small molecules
